item.description:
I noticed an interesting talk at Old south I'm going to check out:

The BostonMob Guide: Hit Men, Hoodlums & Hideouts-The capture of James “Whitey” Bulger closed an infamous chapter in Boston history. Yet the city’s criminal underworld has a long and bloody rap sheet that stretches back to the beginning of the Twentieth Century. Boston journalists Beverly Ford and Stephanie Schorow reveal the real story of the underbelly of Boston through profiles of ruthless gangsters and the backrooms and seedy hangouts where deadly hits and lucrative heists were hatched. This program is funded in part by the Lowell Institute. Book sales and signing to follow. Free and open to the public

http://oldsouthmeetinghouse.org/osmh_123456789files/calender.aspx

I've been to talks at Old south before and they're usually pretty good plus the surroundings are neat and worth the trip if you've never been. I am very likely to head across the street after to the most historic Chipolte in the country or possibly for a pint at 4 green fields up the street
item.how_to_find_us: I'll wait outside until 6:15 and then go in to get seats. If you're late I'll email my # to meet up after
item.name: The Boston Mob Guide - Talk at Old South
